props.description: A ref to the element rendered by this component. Because this component is polymorphic, the type will vary based on the value of the as prop.
props.title: ref

props.description: The underlying element to render â€” either a HTML element name or a React component.
props.title: as

props.description: Element to be rendered inside the Box component.
props.title: children

props.description: The gap property sets the gaps between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for rowGap and columnGap.
props.title: gap

props.description: The gridGap property sets the gaps between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for rowGap and columnGap.
props.title: gridGap

props.description: The backgroundColor property sets the background color of the box.
props.title: backgroundColor

props.description: The color property is used to set the color of the box.
props.title: color

props.description: The borderRadius property rounds the corners of an box's outer border edge.
props.title: borderRadius

props.description: The borderWidth property sets the width of an box's border.
props.title: borderWidth

props.description: The borderTopWidth property defines the width of the border at the top of a box.
props.title: borderTopWidth

props.description: The borderBottomWidth property defines the width of the border at the bottom of a box.
props.title: borderBottomWidth

props.description: The borderLeftWidth property defines the width of the border at the left of a box.
props.title: borderLeftWidth

props.description: The borderRightWidth property defines the width of the border at the right of a box.
props.title: borderRightWidth

props.description: The borderWidthX shorthand property defines the width of the element's border on the left and right.
props.title: borderWidthX

props.description: The borderWidthY shorthand property defines the width of the element's border on the top and bottom.
props.title: borderWidthY

props.description: The borderColor property sets the color of the box's four borders.
props.title: borderColor

props.description: The boxShadow property adds shadow effects around an box's frame.
props.title: boxShadow

props.description: The padding properties are used to generate space around an box's content area.
props.title: padding

props.description: The paddingTop property sets the height of the padding area on the top of an box.
props.title: paddingTop

props.description: The paddingBottom property sets the height of the padding area on the bottom of an box.
props.title: paddingBottom

props.description: The paddingLeft property sets the width of the padding area to the left of an box.
props.title: paddingLeft

props.description: The paddingLeft property sets the width of the padding area to the right of an box.
props.title: paddingRight

props.description: The margin shorthand property sets the margin area on all four sides of an box.
props.title: margin

props.description: The marginTop property sets the margin area on the top of an box.
props.title: marginTop

props.description: The marginBottom property sets the margin area on the bottom of an box.
props.title: marginBottom

props.description: The marginLeft property sets the margin area on the left side of an box.
props.title: marginLeft

props.description: The marginRight property sets the margin area on the right side of an box.
props.title: marginRight

props.description: The zIndex property specifies the stack order of the box.
props.title: zIndex

props.description: The p shorthand property sets the margin area on all four sides of an box.
props.title: p

props.description: The pl shorthand property sets the width of the padding area to the left of an box.
props.title: pl

props.description: The pl shorthand property sets the width of the padding area to the right of an box.
props.title: pr

props.description: The pt shorthand property sets the height of the padding area on the top of an box.
props.title: pt

props.description: The pb shorthand property sets the height of the padding area on the botton of an box.
props.title: pb

props.description: The px shorthand property defines the width of the left and right padding area of a box.
props.title: px

props.description: The py pt shorthand property sets the height of the padding area at the top and bottom of a box.
props.title: py

props.description: The paddingX shorthand property defines the width of the left and right padding area of a box.
props.title: paddingX

props.description: The paddingY pt shorthand property sets the height of the padding area at the top and bottom of a box.
props.title: paddingY

props.description: The m shorthand property sets the margin area on all four sides of an box.
props.title: m

props.description: The mr property sets the margin area on the right side of an box.
props.title: mr

props.description: The ml property sets the margin area on the left side of an box.
props.title: ml

props.description: The mt property sets the margin area on the top of an box.
props.title: mt

props.description: The marginBottom property sets the margin area on the bottom of an box.
props.title: mb

props.description: The mx property defines the margin area on the left and right side of a box.
props.title: mx

props.description: The my property defines the margin area on the top and bottom of a box
props.title: my

props.description: The marginX property defines the margin area on the left and right side of a box.
props.title: marginX

props.description: The marginY property defines the margin area on the top and bottom of a box
props.title: marginY

props.description: The fontSize property sets the size of the box.
props.title: fontSize

props.description: The fontWeight property sets how thick or thin characters in box should be displayed.
props.title: fontWeight

props.description: The lineHeight property specifies the line height of the box.
props.title: lineHeight

props.description:
The **`top`** CSS property participates in specifying the vertical position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: top

props.description:
The **`bottom`** CSS property participates in setting the vertical position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: bottom

props.description:
The **`width`** CSS property sets an element's width. By default, it sets the width of the content area, but if `box-sizing` is set to `border-box`, it sets the width of the border area.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: width

props.description:
The **`position`** CSS property sets how an element is positioned in a document. The `top`, `right`, `bottom`, and `left` properties determine the final location of positioned elements.


**Initial value**: `static`
props.title: position

props.description:
The CSS **`align-content`** property sets the distribution of space between and around content items along a flexbox's cross-axis or a grid's block axis.


**Initial value**: `normal`
props.title: alignContent

props.description:
The CSS **`align-items`** property sets the `align-self` value on all direct children as a group. In Flexbox, it controls the alignment of items on the Cross Axis. In Grid Layout, it controls the alignment of items on the Block Axis within their grid area.


**Initial value**: `normal`
props.title: alignItems

props.description:
The **`align-self`** CSS property overrides a grid or flex item's `align-items` value. In Grid, it aligns the item inside theÂ grid area. In Flexbox, it aligns the item on the cross axis.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: alignSelf

props.description:
The **`background-blend-mode`** CSS property sets how an element's background images should blend with each other and with the element's background color.


**Initial value**: `normal`
props.title: backgroundBlendMode

props.description:
The **`background-image`** CSS property sets one or more background images on an element.


**Initial value**: `none`
props.title: backgroundImage

props.description:
The **`background-repeat`** CSS property sets how background images are repeated. A background image can be repeated along the horizontal and vertical axes, or not repeated at all.


**Initial value**: `repeat`
props.title: backgroundRepeat

props.description:
The **`background-size`** CSS property sets the size of the element's background image. The image can be left to its natural size, stretched, or constrained to fit the available space.


**Initial value**: `auto auto`
props.title: backgroundSize

props.description:
The **`box-sizing`** CSS property sets how the total width and height of an element is calculated.


**Initial value**: `content-box`
props.title: boxSizing

props.description:
The **`cursor`** CSS property sets the type of mouse cursor, if any, to show when the mouse pointer is over an element.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: cursor

props.description:
The **`display`** CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline element and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.


**Initial value**: `inline`
props.title: display

props.description:
The **`flex-basis`** CSS property sets the initial main size of a flex item. It sets the size of the content box unless otherwise set with `box-sizing`.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: flexBasis

props.description:
The **`flex-direction`** CSS property sets how flex items are placed in the flex container defining the main axis and the direction (normal or reversed).


**Initial value**: `row`
props.title: flexDirection

props.description:
The **`flex-grow`** CSSÂ property sets the flex grow factor of a flex item main size.


**Initial value**: `0`
props.title: flexGrow

props.description:
The **`flex-shrink`** CSS property sets the flex shrink factor of a flex item. If the size of all flex items is larger than the flex container, items shrink to fit according to `flex-shrink`.


**Initial value**: `1`
props.title: flexShrink

props.description:
The **`flex-wrap`** CSS property sets whether flex items are forced onto one line or can wrap onto multiple lines. If wrapping is allowed, it sets the direction that lines are stacked.


**Initial value**: `nowrap`
props.title: flexWrap

props.description:
The **`grid-template-areas`** CSS property specifies named grid areas, establishing the cells in the grid and assigning them names.


**Initial value**: `none`
props.title: gridTemplateAreas

props.description:
The **`grid-template-columns`** CSS property defines the line names and track sizing functions of the grid columns.


**Initial value**: `none`
props.title: gridTemplateColumns

props.description:
The **`grid-template-rows`** CSS property defines the line names and track sizing functions of the grid rows.


**Initial value**: `none`
props.title: gridTemplateRows

props.description:
The **`height`** CSS property specifies the height of an element. By default, the property defines the height of the content area. If `box-sizing` is set to `border-box`, however, it instead determines the height of the border area.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: height

props.description:
The CSS **`justify-content`** property defines how the browser distributes space between and around content items along the main-axis of a flex container, and the inline axis of a grid container.


**Initial value**: `normal`
props.title: justifyContent

props.description:
The CSS **`justify-items`** property defines the default `justify-self` for all items of the box, giving them all a default way of justifying each box along the appropriate axis.


**Initial value**: `legacy`
props.title: justifyItems

props.description:
The **`left`** CSS property participates in specifying the horizontal position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: left

props.description:
The **`max-height`** CSS property sets the maximum height of an element. It prevents the used value of the `height` property from becoming larger than the value specified for `max-height`.


**Initial value**: `none`
props.title: maxHeight

props.description:
The **`max-width`** CSS property sets the maximum width of an element. It prevents the used value of the `width` property from becoming larger than the value specified by `max-width`.


**Initial value**: `none`
props.title: maxWidth

props.description:
The **`min-height`** CSS property sets the minimum height of an element. It prevents the used value of the `height` property from becoming smaller than the value specified for `min-height`.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: minHeight

props.description:
The **`min-width`** CSS property sets the minimum width of an element. It prevents the used value of the `width` property from becoming smaller than the value specified for `min-width`.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: minWidth

props.description:
The **`order`** CSS property sets the order to lay out an item in a flex or grid container. Items in a container are sorted by ascending `order` value and then by their source code order.


**Initial value**: `0`
props.title: order

props.description:
The **`overflow-x`** CSS property sets what shows when content overflows a block-level element's left and right edges. This may be nothing, a scroll bar, or the overflow content.


**Initial value**: `visible`
props.title: overflowX

props.description:
The **`overflow-y`** CSS property sets what shows when content overflows a block-level element's top and bottom edges. This may be nothing, a scroll bar, or the overflow content.


**Initial value**: `visible`
props.title: overflowY

props.description:
The **`pointer-events`** CSS property sets under what circumstances (if any) a particular graphic element can become the target of pointer events.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: pointerEvents

props.description:
The **`right`** CSS property participates in specifying the horizontal position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.


**Initial value**: `auto`
props.title: right

props.description:
The **`text-align`** CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of aÂ block element or table-cell box. This means it works like `vertical-align` but in the horizontal direction.


**Initial value**: `start`, or a nameless value that acts as `left` if _direction_ is `ltr`, `right` if _direction_ is `rtl` if `start` is not supported by the browser.
props.title: textAlign

props.description:
The **`transition-delay`** CSS property specifies the duration to wait before starting a property's transition effect when its value changes.


**Initial value**: `0s`
props.title: transitionDelay

props.description:
The **`transition-property`** CSS property sets the CSS properties to which a transition effect should be applied.


**Initial value**: all
props.title: transitionProperty

props.description:
The **`transition-timing-function`** CSS property sets how intermediate values are calculated for CSS properties being affected by a transition effect.


**Initial value**: `ease`
props.title: transitionTimingFunction

props.description:
The **`background-position`** CSS property sets the initial position for each background image. The position is relative to the position layer set by `background-origin`.


**Initial value**: `0% 0%`
props.title: backgroundPosition

props.description: The **`border-style`** shorthand CSS property sets the line style for all four sides of an element's border.
props.title: borderStyle

props.description: The **`flex`** CSS shorthand property sets how a flex _item_ will grow or shrink to fit the space available in its flex container.
props.title: flex

props.description: The **`flex-flow`** CSS shorthand property specifies the direction of a flex container, as well as its wrapping behavior.
props.title: flexFlow

props.description: The **`grid-area`** CSS shorthand property specifies a grid itemâ€™s size and location within a grid by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the edges of its grid area.
props.title: gridArea

props.description:
The **`overflow`** CSS shorthand property sets the desired behavior for an element's overflow â€” i.e. when an element's content is too big to fit in its block formatting context â€” in both directions.


**Initial value**: `visible`
props.title: overflow

props.description: The **`text-decoration`** shorthand CSS property sets the appearance of decorative lines on text. It is a shorthand for `text-decoration-line`, `text-decoration-color`, `text-decoration-style`, and the newer `text-decoration-thickness` property.
props.title: textDecoration
